channel.title: PowerBI on DataSkool Blog
channel.description: Recent content in PowerBI on DataSkool Blog

item.title: Integrating Python with Power BI
item.description: Microsoft have recently added Python support to Power BI Desktop. This is available as a preview feature for Power BI Desktop, yet a nice feature for those who uses Python on a day to day basis. Python is an open source general purpose language and has become one of top prigramming languages for data science. Power BI is Microsoft’s flagship BI tool for creating dashboards and interactive reports. Similar to R, with Python as a backend engine for Power BI Desktop, you can do many cool things, which can be categorized into three broad applications–

item.title: Integrating R with Power BI
item.description: Microsoft Power BI Desktop version nicely integrates with R. R is an open source software for statistical computing and graphics. R has become popular among the data scientists because of its powerful data analytics and visualization capabilities. Power BI is Microsoft’s flagship BI tool for creating dashboards and interactive reports. With R as a backend engine for Power BI Desktop, you can do many cool things, which can be categorized into three broad applications–
